title: Ryanair faces massive fine in Italy over 'abusive strategy'

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un, daughter open luxury resort

title: This is how Christmas is celebrated at the Vatican

title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy cautiously optimistic about peace talks

title: UK: Banksy unveils latest mural in London

title: Why Trump backs Bayer in Roundup weedkiller cancer battle

title: UK: 'Driving Home For Christmas' singer Chris Rea dies

title: Denmark fumes over new US envoy to Greenland

content: The northern and southern lights, especially active lately, have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance

content: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
creator: Unknown author
content: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

content: Drone sightings this year have disrupted German airports, causing headaches for travelers. Germany has ordered special anti-aircraft tanks to combat the unmanned aerial vehicles.

content: Macron said that France needed to be "strong to be feared" as Paris aims to enhance its projection as a naval power.

title: AI language models duped by poems

content: A new study has shown that prompts in the form of poems confuse AI models like ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude — to the point where sometimes, security mechanisms don't kick in. Are poets the new hackers?

creator: Unknown author

content: Excellent infrastructure, ambitious teams, young stars and veterans who are far from finished — the 35th edition of AFCON promises plenty.
